text: Rye is an extinct town in Adair County, in the U.S. state of Missouri. The GNIS classifies it as a populated place, but the exact location of the town site is unknown. A post office called Rye was established in 1882, and remained in operation until 1884. The community most likely was named after their rye crop. ==References== Category:Ghost towns in Missouri Category:Former populated places in Adair County, Missouri
title: Rye, Missouri
